citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) failed to provide written IACUC-
approved protocols with all required assurances and/or statements. Specifically, the protocols lacked the following
information: alternatives to procedures that may cause more than momentary or slight pain or distress to the animals,
along with a written narrative description of the methods and sources; procedure(s) unnecessarily duplicates previous
experiments; qualified and trained personnel are involved with procedures; rationale for species and number of animals;
rationale for using animals; complete description of proposed used of the animals; and complete description of method of
euthanasia to be used. Failure to include these statements and assurances in the IACUC-approved protocols can
jeopardize the health and well-being of the animals used in said protocols/studies, in addition to potentially altering
outcomes which could invalidate the entire purpose of the protocols/studies and therefore the use of these animals. In
order to approve proposed activities, the IACUC must conduct a review of those components of the activities related to
the care and use of animals and determine that the proposed activities are in accordance with this subchapter unless
acceptable justification for a departure is presented in writing. Furthermore, the IACUC must determine that the proposed
activities meet all requirements mentioned in this subchapter (specifically 2.31(d)(1) and (e)).
Correct by: August 16, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
